titleStmt.title: S.W. Hall v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: S.W. Hall v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Olympia, for the counties of Thurston, Lewis, Chehalis, and Mason
In the matter of the application of S W Hall for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Honorable Roger S Greene Judge of said District Court:

The petition of S W Hall respectfully shows: That the said S W Hall is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by William Billings Sheriff of said Thurston County at the county jail in said Thurston county in the Territory of Washington.
That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal and that the illegality thereof consists in this, to wit:
That your petitioner the said S W Hall is not the person mentioned and described in the warrant of arrest or process under which said William Billings sheriff holds your petitioner.

Wherefore, your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted, directed to the said William Billings Sheriff as aforesaid, commanding him to have the body of your petitioner before your Honor, at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall be then and there considered by your Honor, concerning your petitioner, together with the time and causes of his detention and said writ, and that your petitioner may be restored to his liberty.
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } SS
S W Hall, being duly sworn, says: that he is the petitioner named in the foregoing petition; that he has read the said petition, and knows the contents thereof, and that the same is true S W Hall
Subscribed and sworn to before me this sixth day of January 1879 N.N. Nerdin Notary Public in and for Thurston County Wash. Ty.
In the matter of the application of S.W. Hall for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
